basic_info.overview_description: Visual Studio Code is a free, open-source code editor developed by Microsoft. It features IntelliSense code completion, debugging, Git integration, extensions, and support for multiple programming languages.
key_features: IntelliSense code completion and syntax highlighting
Extensive extension marketplace with thousands of extensions
Multi-language support with custom themes and syntax highlighting
Extensive keyboard shortcuts and productivity features
Built-in support for TypeScript, JavaScript, and Node.js
supported_platforms: Linux (Ubuntu, Debian, Red Hat, Fedora, SUSE)

technical_specs.performance_considerations: Lightweight editor with fast startup, extension ecosystem may impact performance
supported_languages: JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Java, C++, C#, PHP, Go, Rust, Ruby, Swift
HTML, CSS, JSON, XML, Markdown, SQL
Docker, Kubernetes, Azure, AWS, Google Cloud
technical_specs.hardware_requirements: 4GB RAM minimum, modern CPU, sufficient disk space
technical_specs.network_requirements: Internet connection for extensions and updates

installation_setup: Download Visual Studio Code from the official website (code.visualstudio.com)
Install extensions from the marketplace for additional functionality
Configure settings and keyboard shortcuts for optimal workflow
Set up Git integration for version control
Install language-specific extensions for your development needs
setup_info.configuration_guide: Comprehensive configuration guide available in official documentation
setup_info.quick_start_tutorial: Quick start tutorial available in official documentation and tutorials
setup_info.environment_setup: Environment setup instructions available in official documentation
setup_info.dependency_management: Dependency management tools and best practices available in documentation
setup_info.installation_commands: Installation commands available in official documentation and setup guides
setup_info.setup_steps: Detailed setup steps available in official documentation
setup_info.verification_commands: Verification commands available in official documentation

community_tutorials: Community tutorials available on GitHub, YouTube, and blogs
video_tutorials: Video tutorials available on YouTube and official channels
sample_projects: Sample projects available on GitHub and official repositories

community.community_support: Active community with forums, Discord, and GitHub discussions

legal_versioning.version_history: Comprehensive version history and changelog available
legal_versioning.update_policy: Regular update schedule with security and feature updates
legal_versioning.end_of_life: Long-term support with clear end-of-life policies

demo_links: Live demos available on official website

language_support: JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Java, C++, C#, PHP, Go, Rust, Ruby, Swift
HTML, CSS, JSON, XML, Markdown, SQL
Docker, Kubernetes, Azure, AWS, Google Cloud
